str2: And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A censer. From libanos; frankincense, i.e. a censer for burning it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To fill, load. Transitive from gemo; to fill entirely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An altar (for sacrifice). From a derivative of thusia; a place of sacrifice, i.e. An altar.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Thunder. Akin to bremo; thunder.
And, even, also, namely.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
And, even, also, namely.
A flash of lightning, brightness, luster. From astrapto; lightning; by analogy, glare.
And, even, also, namely.
A shaking (as an earthquake); a storm. From seio; a commotion, i.e. a gale, an earthquake.
